la_resoluci√≥n_de_disputas_es_un.en: Dispute resolution is a term used in both commercial law and private law, and its definition is not difficult to understand. In its most basic form, dispute resolution is the resolution of a dispute between two or more parties.

mediaci√≥n___la_mediaci√≥n_es_un.en: Mediation - Mediation is a dispute resolution process, but it can take many forms. It is fundamentally a process where the disputing parties meet in a place with an independent person present who will work between the parties to help secure a resolution of the dispute or to reduce the issues between the parties. The parties will need to participate in the mediation, including preparatory work, and if an agreement is reached, they will be bound by that agreement. Documents may be shared and presented both before and during the mediation. Mediation is less formal and, as such, is usually much cheaper than alternatives (arbitration or litigation). The mediator's goal is to remain impartial throughout the process and work between the parties. In mediation, the parties agree on a resolution. The mediator will simply facilitate this and will not make the decision for the parties. It is always prudent in mediation to draft a settlement or resolution agreement that is signed by both parties to avoid any confusion at a later date. Mediation is less formal than arbitration or litigation and is often a preferred route due to this and the cost. Mediation is confidential and gives the parties the opportunity to agree on terms that a court or arbitrator could not in an arbitration award or court judgment. The parties must voluntarily agree to mediate and must also voluntarily agree to any settlement agreement. A settlement agreement is a legally binding contract, meaning that if one party does not comply with it, legal action can be taken to enforce it. However, in our experience, once an agreement is reached in mediation, the parties will typically comply with it.
mediaci√≥n___la_mediaci√≥n_es_un.es: Mediaci√≥n - La mediaci√≥n es un proceso de resoluci√≥n de disputas, pero puede tomar muchas formas. Es fundamentalmente un proceso en el que las partes en disputa se re√∫nen en un lugar con una persona independiente presente que trabajar√° entre las partes para ayudar a asegurar una resoluci√≥n de la disputa, o para reducir los problemas entre las partes. Las partes deber√°n participar en la mediaci√≥n, incluido el trabajo preparatorio, y si se llega a un acuerdo, estar√°n obligadas por ese acuerdo. Los documentos pueden ser compartidos y presentados tanto antes como durante la mediaci√≥n. La mediaci√≥n es menos formal y, como tal, suele ser mucho m√°s barata que las alternativas (arbitraje o litigio). El objetivo del mediador es mantenerse imparcial durante todo el proceso y trabajar entre las partes. En la mediaci√≥n, las partes acuerdan una resoluci√≥n. El mediador simplemente facilitar√° esto y no tomar√° la decisi√≥n por las partes. Siempre es prudente en una mediaci√≥n redactar un acuerdo de liquidaci√≥n o resoluci√≥n que sea firmado por ambas partes para evitar cualquier confusi√≥n en una fecha posterior. La mediaci√≥n es menos formal que el arbitraje o el litigio y a menudo es una ruta preferida debido a esto y al costo. La mediaci√≥n es confidencial y brinda a las partes la oportunidad de acordar t√©rminos que un tribunal o √°rbitro no podr√≠a hacer en una sentencia arbitral o una sentencia judicial. Las partes deben acordar voluntariamente mediar y tambi√©n deben acordar voluntariamente cualquier acuerdo de liquidaci√≥n. Un acuerdo de liquidaci√≥n es un contrato legalmente vinculante, lo que significa que si una de las partes no cumple con √©l, se pueden tomar medidas legales para hacerlo cumplir. Sin embargo, en nuestra experiencia, una vez que se llega a un acuerdo en la mediaci√≥n, las partes normalmente lo cumplir√°n.
mediaci√≥n___la_mediaci√≥n_es_un.pt: Media√ß√£o - A media√ß√£o √© um processo de resolu√ß√£o de disputas, mas pode assumir muitas formas. √â fundamentalmente um processo em que as partes em disputa se re√∫nem em um local com uma pessoa independente presente que trabalhar√° entre as partes para ajudar a garantir uma resolu√ß√£o da disputa ou para reduzir os problemas entre as partes. arbitraje___el_arbitraje_es_un.en: Arbitration - Arbitration is a more formal legal process compared to mediation. The process follows many aspects of the court litigation process, but the parties and the arbitrator have a greater degree of flexibility. Details of the conflict are presented to the arbitrator in the form of documents and oral representation if appropriate. Based on the information provided, the arbitrator will make a decision to resolve the conflict. It should be noted that there may be more than one arbitrator, which is usually dictated by the complexity of the case or if multiple issues arise that require greater expertise to make a decision. Arbitration is private, which is an important factor for parties choosing to use arbitration instead of litigation to resolve their conflicts. Another benefit is that if the conflict involves technical issues, it is possible to appoint an arbitrator with relevant expertise in the field. Arbitration is generally considered cheaper than litigation and, more importantly, the parties can have greater influence over the process without the court imposing deadlines and penalties. The flexibility offered by the arbitration process often makes it a better solution for resolving conflicts. It is usually prudent to have a dispute resolution lawyer represent you in arbitration; this is a formal legal process where documents and evidence will be collected and disclosed, and experienced legal advice is recommended. The time and cost savings tend to arise from the degree of control the parties can exercise over the process and the fact that there is no need to wait for court time to be available for hearings. Arbitration awards are generally enforceable similarly to court judgments and can be enforced in most countries.

Por lo general, es prudente tener un abogado de resoluci√≥n de conflictos que lo represente en el arbitraje; este es un proceso legal formal donde se recopilar√°n y revelar√°n documentos y pruebas, y se recomienda tomar asesoramiento legal experimentado. El ahorro de tiempo y costos tiende a surgir del grado de control que las partes pueden ejercer sobre el proceso y el hecho de que no es necesario esperar a que haya tiempo disponible en la corte para las audiencias. Los laudos arbitrales son generalmente ejecutables de manera similar a la ejecuci√≥n de las sentencias judiciales y se pueden hacer cumplir en la mayor√≠a de los pa√≠ses.

Outro benef√≠cio √© que se o conflito envolver quest√µes t√©cnicas, √© poss√≠vel nomear um √°rbitro com experi√™ncia relevante no campo. Geralmente √© prudente ter um advogado de resolu√ß√£o de disputas representando voc√™ na arbitragem; este √© um processo legal formal onde documentos e provas ser√£o coletados e divulgados, e √© recomendado buscar aconselhamento legal experiente. litigio___el_litigio_es_un.en: Litigation - Litigation is a formal legal process that uses the available civil legal system to resolve a dispute. When a matter is litigated (the filing of a lawsuit in court), you and your dispute resolution lawyer will need to follow a set of rules applied by the courts, and the court will dictate the path and pace at which the litigation proceeds, applying a set of deadlines for the parties to take action and prepare the case for a final hearing. Litigation can be complex and time-consuming. While an individual may represent themselves (this is expected in small claims court), it is sensible to use a dispute resolution lawyer to manage the litigation and ensure that the complex legal processes are handled effectively. Due to the people and time involved in litigation (lawyers, judges, experts, and judges), litigation can become very expensive. While most litigation is resolved before a final hearing where a judge will determine the outcome of the case, some conflicts cannot be resolved before trial, with the final outcome being a full hearing before a judge. With the exception of most family proceedings, legal proceedings are NOT private, and once concluded, they are legally binding (subject to appeals), so both parties must comply with the outcome. The UK legal system is complex and steeped in history, with a set of rules and case law that must be followed. This is a specialized area and requires expert advice and guidance.

el_sistema_legal_del_reino_unido.en: The UK legal system has been driving parties towards resolution rather than litigation, with courts often taking an unfavorable view of parties who have not attempted to resolve their matter outside the litigation process. If a contract has a provision for mediation or arbitration to resolve a dispute, it is almost certain that a party who chooses to ignore this will receive criticism from a court with financial consequences. Therefore, before deciding to embrace or dismiss resolution by means other than litigation, be sure to review the details of your contract or ask your specialist dispute resolution lawyer to review your contract if you are unsure. These Rules regulate all other relationships between the participants of the ValorCasino betting company and the customer. These Rules apply to customers of the ValorCasino.com site and affiliated sites. Bet - an agreement on the victory concluded between the customer and the betting company, according to the established Rules, while the result of this agreement depends on the event, regarding which it is not known whether it will happen or not. The acceptance of bets from customers is carried out on the terms offered by the betting company. Result is the outcome of the event (events) on which the bet was placed. Customer is the person who places a bet on the outcome of the event at the betting company. Line is a set of events, possible outcomes of these events, coefficients on the possible outcomes of these events, their date and time, after which the betting company stops accepting bets on the outcomes of these events. Cancellation of the bet is an event for which no calculation and payment is made. In case of 'cancellation of the bet', according to these Rules, the transaction between the organizer and the customer is considered null and void and a refund is made for such a bet. The normal playing time is the duration of the match according to the rules of this sport, including injury time added by the referee. The normal playing time does not include injury time, extra time, penalties, etc.

de_acuerdo_con_la_pol√≠tica_interna.en: In accordance with the internal money laundering prevention policy (AML-Policy), the company conducts initial and ongoing identity checks of the company's users according to the level of potential risk associated with each user. The company will ask you to provide the minimum information to verify your identity. The company will record and store the data and documents that prove your identity, as well as information about the methods used to verify your identity and the results of the checks. The company may check your personal data for matches with the list of persons suspected of terrorism, formed by authorized state and independent bodies. To verify and confirm the authenticity of the above data, the Company may require the following documents from the user: passport or identity card, or another document that replaces them, which meets the following requirements: - contains the name, date of birth and photo of the document holder; - was issued by national government agencies, a recent utility bill (no older than 3 months) or another document that can confirm the user's residential address. The company may also request video identification or other additional information, supported by relevant documents. In certain cases, the Company may also request notarized copies of documents from the user.

Play only with money that you can afford to lose. Do not try to recover after a loss. 15. Avoid gambling if you are under the influence of alcohol or any other substance.

requisitos_de_apuestas___significa_la.en: Wagering requirements - means the total amount of bets you must place before the Bonus and accumulated winnings are transferred to your cash balance and can be withdrawn. Betting coefficient - means the coefficient that is calculated as follows: number of bets to be placed / amount of nominated bonus. Game contribution - means the percentage of bets within the game that contribute to the wagering requirements. Example: you have received a ‚Ç¨100 bonus with a betting coefficient of x30. To transfer the bonus balance to cash balance, you must place ‚Ç¨3000 in bets (10030). ‚Ç¨3,000 is your Wagering Requirement. If you choose the game with a 100% contribution, then the calculation of the Wagering Requirement is as follows: (‚Ç¨10030)100% = ‚Ç¨3,000. If you choose the game with a 10% contribution, then the calculation of the Wagering Requirement is as follows: (‚Ç¨10030)*10% = ‚Ç¨30,000. On https://Valor.Bet the following game contributions apply: Casino slots (except video poker) - 100%. Poker, video poker, roulette, baccarat, blackjack, table games, lotteries, scratch cards, bingo, keno - 0%. Live casino all categories - 0%. Live games / TV games all categories - 10%. Virtual sports all categories - 10%. Aviator - 0%.

P√≥ker, video p√≥ker, ruleta, baccarat, blackjack, juegos de mesa, loter√≠as, tarjetas rasca y gana, bingo, keno - 0%. Casino en vivo todas las categor√≠as - 0%. la_compa√±√≠a_de_apuestas_ofrece_los.en: The betting company offers the following types of bets: 1. Single bet - is a bet on the outcome of a particular event. Winning a single bet is equivalent to multiplying the bet amount by the odds set for this outcome. 2. Accumulators - is a bet on the outcomes of several independent events. The win in an accumulator is equivalent to multiplying the bet amount by the odds of all the outcomes included in the accumulator. Losing one of the outcomes of the accumulator means losing the entire accumulator. 3. System - is a bet on a complete combination of accumulators of a certain size from a preselected number of events. The maximum number of options in the system is 924. The maximum number of events in the system is 12. Acceptance of bets during the match (live bets) 1. Live bets are accepted on the main and additional outcomes. It is possible to make live single bets and combine them into an accumulator. 2. A bet is considered accepted after its registration on the server and then an online confirmation is issued. The accepted bet is not subject to change. In case of the occurrence of the circumstances specified in the section Results of the match, the date and time of the start, the procedure for resolving controversial issues. 3. Under certain circumstances specified in the 'Rules for sports', it is possible to calculate a live bet with odds of. 4. The betting company is not responsible for inaccuracies in the current results of matches for which live bets are accepted. Customers should also use other independent sources of information. 5. Live bets cannot be edited or deleted.
